titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Donald N. Smith papers

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: Donald N. Smith was Associate Director of the Office for the Study of Automotive Transportation in the University of Michigan Transportation Research Institute. Smith was interested in the technological innovations of numerical controls in manufacturing and the machine tool industry.
archdesc.scopecontent: Contains a chronicle of numeric control developments and a compilation of resources and documents relating to the development and growth of the field including Smith's guide "Numerical Control Innovation and Revolution: An Archival Research Aid," and an autobiography of pioneer John T. Parsons.
